title: Why did the USSR give Manchuria back to China after WWII? - Quora

response.answer_text: Soviet government was co-operating with its allies. Stalin had agreed at the Yalta Conference to join the war with Japan within three months of Germany's defeat. He did so, but waited to the last day. He clearly wasn't eager to grab territory in the East. When Japan was surrendering a few days later, he agreed to stop its advance in Korea at the 38th parallel, as requested by the US, even though he could have occupied the whole country without firing a shot. Finally, the Soviet Union had good relations with the Republic of China (as well as with Mao's Communists).
